intro: Lyonsia largiflorens, commonly known as the large-flowered lyonsia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible roots. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough, textured surface. Lyonsia largiflorens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
